intro: Chiastophyllum, commonly known as the "sacred fern," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Chiastophyllum species typically thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in swampy or marshy areas. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them valuable subjects in botanical studies.
